title: Frank Lampard acting as 'agony uncle' to solve Chelsea stars' love woes
text:

He’s riding high as new boss of his beloved Chelsea FC.

And he’s making sure there’s no sign of the Blues... because Frank Lampard has turned agony uncle.

The ex-England ace has been dishing out marital advice to his players. Lamps knows a thing or two about relationships after wedding TV’s Christine Bleakley, 40, following his split from long-term lover Elen Rivas, 41.

He reveals: “A couple of situations have arisen this year with players who have issues at home and I’ve given advice when I’ve felt that I was in a good position to do so.”

Dad-of-three Frank, 41, says he has former One Show host Christine to thank for helping him get over his split from Spaniard Elen.

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

“I was living alone,” he says. “Two of my mates moved in with me, which isn’t really conducive to being a professional athlete.

"Some of the things we were getting up to – going out, sitting up too late…

“But I had a really good year, scored a lot of goals, important goals. Then I met Christine and was so happy for the latter years of my career, from 2010 onwards.”

He was talking to comedian and Chelsea supporter Omid Djalili for new book A Game of Two Halves: Famous Football Fans Meet Their Heroes.

(Image: Getty Images)

Lamps praises the influence his dad Frank Senior, 71 – who starred for West Ham United – has had on his life.

He adds: “I’m lucky to have grown up in a very sound family unit, with a lot of love from my mum and football knowledge from my dad.

“So I was quite secure. But I know not everybody has that.”
description: EXCLUSIVE: Former England midfielder admits 'a couple of situations have arisen with players who have issues at home and I’ve given advice'
